intro: Matelea ganglinosa, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically bright yellow or orange, blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Matelea ganglinosa is often grown for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
